newsitem.title: JAPAN: Apple Computer to launch Japan-only notebook PC.
newsitem.headline: Apple Computer to launch Japan-only notebook PC.

text.p: Apple Computer Inc is to launch a notebook computer this month designed solely for the Japanese market and aims to sell 60,000 units of the model by the year-end, Apple Japan Inc president Eiko Harada said on Thursday.
The new notebook personal computer, the Macintosh PowerBook 2400c/180, was jointly developed by Apple's Japan unit and IBM Japan Ltd, a unit of International Business Machines Corp.

At a news conference announcing the Japanese-language computer, to be marketed towards the end of May, Harada also said Apple Japan shipped 800,000 units of Apple computers in 1996. He declined to give a sales target for this year.
Regarding the company's sales target for the year 2000, he said: "I can't give an exact figure, but we are certain that our company will grow as fast as the market."
